opportunities.name: Sleek
opportunities.why_viral: Went from launch to $10k MRR in just 6 weeks. It capitalizes on the 'vibe coding' trend where non-designers need high-quality visual output instantly.

opportunities.name: SuperX
opportunities.why_viral: Hit $23k MRR in six months with zero paid marketing, relying entirely on viral content loops. Shows the persistent value of platform-specific tooling.

opportunities.name: PayPerCrawl
opportunities.why_viral: Addresses a massive 2026 pain point: AI companies scraping content for free. It turns a defensive need (blocking bots) into a revenue stream.

opportunities.name: OpenClaw
opportunities.why_viral: Viral open-source alternative to proprietary 'vibe coding' tools. It represents the growing demand for local-first, privacy-focused AI agents.

opportunities.name: Agentset
opportunities.why_viral: Launched Feb 2026 on Product Hunt. Fills the gap between simple RAG demos and actual production-ready infrastructure for indie devs.

opportunities.name: SiteGPT
opportunities.why_viral: A classic indie success story that scaled to $13k+ MRR. It proves that simple, well-executed wrappers around LLMs solving specific business problems remain profitable.

opportunities.name: Queue
opportunities.why_viral: Reached $134k MRR as a solo/small team project. It targets the booming 'productized service' economy.

opportunities.name: PDF.ai
opportunities.why_viral: Simple utility that scaled to $100k MRR. Demonstrates that doing one simple thing extremely well (chat with docs) can still beat complex enterprise suites.

opportunities.name: Senja.io
opportunities.why_viral: Bootstrapped to $1M ARR. It solves a universal problem for every other indie maker: social proof.

opportunities.name: Screen Studio
opportunities.why_viral: The 'gold standard' for indie hackers sharing demos on X/Twitter. It created its own aesthetic that others are now trying to clone.

patterns.name: The 'Gold Rush' Shovel Strategy
patterns.description: A disproportionate number of successes are B2B tools building specifically for other founders, agencies, and creators.
examples: Senja.io targets SaaS founders needing social proof
Screen Studio targets makers needing high-quality demos
Queue targets the growing 'productized service' agency market
patterns.how_to_apply: Build tools that help other people make money or sell their services more effectively.

patterns.name: Automated Polish / 'Vibe Coding'
patterns.description: Apps that take raw input and instantly apply a high-quality 'professional' aesthetic are winning over complex professional tools.
examples: Sleek allows non-designers to create pro visuals instantly
Screen Studio automatically applies smooth zooms and backgrounds to screen recordings
patterns.how_to_apply: Focus on 'Output Quality' as your main feature. Remove the configuration knobs and just make the result look expensive automatically.

patterns.name: Defensive AI Monetization
patterns.description: Moving from generating content to protecting/gatekeeping content against AI bots.
examples: PayPerCrawl turns the 'problem' of AI scraping into a revenue stream
OpenClaw offers a privacy-focused, local-first alternative to big AI data vacuums
patterns.how_to_apply: Identify where AI is causing a nuisance (scraping, spam, privacy loss) and build a toll booth or shield.

patterns.name: The 'Wrapper' Maturity Phase
patterns.description: Simple AI wrappers are still profitable, but only if they solve a specific workflow friction rather than just exposing the model.
examples: PDF.ai creates a specific UI for document interrogation
SiteGPT solves the specific workflow of training a bot on a sitemap for support
patterns.how_to_apply: Don't just provide chat; provide the specific pre-processing and post-processing context for a narrow task.

patterns.name: Platform Risk/Reward
patterns.description: Building deep tooling for a single platform remains a viable path to $20k+ MRR without paid ads.
examples: SuperX focuses entirely on X/Twitter analytics/growth
SiteGPT focuses on web-based customer support chat
patterns.how_to_apply: Pick a platform (LinkedIn, Reddit, Bluesky) and build the missing 'Pro' suite for it.

gaps: Lack of 'Screen Studio' quality tools for mobile-first demos (vertical video)
Missing infrastructure for monetizing personal data against AI training (Individual version of PayPerCrawl)
Gap between 'No-Code' AI builders and 'Pro-Code' infrastructure (Agentset fills this, but more specific verticals exist)
